item.title: Report X-2024101804
item.description:
Report X-2024101804

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKEING PACKAGE. RESPONDER USED THE DECSION TREE WHICH TOOK THEM TOO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE PAGE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES ON THE RESPONSE SHEET AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

item.title: Report X-2024101753
item.description:
Report X-2024101753

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER AND CONSULTED THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. THE DECSION TREE LEAD TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE PAGE AND RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDELINES OF THE PAGE TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

item.title: Report E-2024100711
item.description:
Report E-2024100711

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0403 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XKC. It was reported that approximately 1 quart of Base Component 512X310 was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by terminal LTU. The release impacted trailer #3119142. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommend a contractor due to goggles, but the facility refused. The waste was managed by terminal personnel.
